item.title: Report X-2024090941
item.description:
Report X-2024090941

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: WYOMING
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WITH SEVERAL BATTERY COMPANY NAMES PRINTED ON THE BOX WAS INSPECTED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO AGM SEALED LEAD ACID BATTERIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. NOTHING ON THE OUTER BOX INDICATING NONSPILLABLE BATTERY. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024090998
item.description:
Report X-2024090998

  • City: LIVONIA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHEN RESPONDER ARRIVED TO THE CALL WEARING PPE AND USING DECISION TREE, SAW THE BOX HAD A WET/SATURATED SPOT ON THE SIDE, NO SPILLAGE ONTO THE BELT OF THE BOXLINE. UPON OPENING, COULD SEE THAT THE CAP WAS ON SLIGHTLY CROOKED, ALLOWING IT TO SLOWLY LEAK OUT.

item.title: Report E-2024090135
item.description:
Report E-2024090135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: KENTWOOD
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 29, 2024, three (3) 30-gallon drums of hypochlorite solution had faulty packaging and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the tops of the drums. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel placed the three (3) damaged 30-gallon drums into three (3) 95-gallon overpack drums that were staged for further handling by R+L terminal personnel. All undamaged freight was restacked for further shipment and processing.

item.title: Report E-2024090131
item.description:
Report E-2024090131

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO XGR contacted ERTS to report a hazardous cargo release. ERTS dispatched SET Environmental to assist with clean up. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and a 5ft-by-5ft area of the asphalt underneath the trailer and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released. SET Environmental personnel transferred the remaining material into a new tote, deployed absorbents, and then swept up the released material. The damaged tote and recovered material were placed into four (4) 55-gallon metal drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.
